group_1.textCenter: If it were only Mikage, I'd understand,@but to think Lady Nayuta too...
Now that the video for the web newspaper is ready,
why don't we play it for just a moment?

group_1.narration: *Click*
"Totally cool Ms. Super Servant's@totally cool cooking action scene!"
"Ms. Super Servant's always so amazing!@She's really good at shopping,@and everyone likes her so much she gets freebies!"
"And all the housewives count on her for help,@so you bet she's amazingly cool!"

group_1.textCenter: it makes me feel a little embarrassed...

group_1.narration: "She fixed Nayutan's and Mii's mistakes!@Even though we thought it was absolutely impossible!"
"People live through trials presented to them,@but ultimately we are made to be saved!"

group_1.textCenter: Everyone is made to be saved.

group_1.narration: Of everything about my past@I have told Mikage and Lady Nayuta,@nearly none of it has been lies.
However, there is one small part@I keep secret from them.
In being frail, my family did save me.
Grandfather grew vegetables for me,@and in turn gave me physical health.
In his life, Father taught me how to read.@After his passing, he left behind many books@that gave me mental health.
Mother, even after Father's passing,@worked as hard as she could,@keeping me healthy in my daily life.
And my family,@embracing their goal of saving me,@granted me the joy of living.
However, I myself took no joy in living.
My family's efforts are why I am alive, saved,@and for that I am grateful,
but I have never found joy in living.
At that time,@I had found Father's journal from when he was alive.
"People live through trials presented to them,@but ultimately we are made to be saved."
Those were his words...
[textBlack:So when I learned@that I could become a Magical Girl and save others,@I was overjoyed.]
[textBlack:I had been saved,@but now I could be the one doing the saving.]
[textBlack:For the first time,@I had found joy in living.]

group_1.textCenter: But Magical Girls are beyond salvation...

group_1.narration: The fact is, I denied Father's words.
To be saved one day...@I clung onto such vague hope@that I felt I had been denied my whole life.
While telling Mikage and Lady Nayuta about my hopes,@I myself have given up all hope.

group_1.textCenter: Did you really believe you could be saved?
Or did you resign yourself@while looking for the light?
